website_summaries.verdict: Between its frantic sci-fi action, intelligent alien adversaries, and countless Xbox Live opponents, this is easily the most comprehensive Halo experience available.
pros: Includes Halo: Combat Evolved Anniversary, Halo 2: Anniversary, Halo 3, and Halo 4
Master Chief’s story is an intense campaign

customer_reviews.title: Halo 1 & 2 - WOW. Halo 3 & 4 - Letterboxed. Seriously?
customer_reviews.text: The remastered versions of Halo 1 & 2 are fantastic - 5 stars all around. I loved playing through Halo 1 & 2 with my son in local co-op splitscreen. When we got to Halo 3 Bungie stopped remastering because I guess they thought it was good enough. The problem is in Halo 3 local co-op splitscreen mode is letterboxed and is annoyingly small, even on a 75" 4K display - boo. Aside from that we love it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miner

customer_reviews.title: Reminds me of long college nights pounding back Red Bull and eating Cheetos on my couch.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome game. Reminds me of long college nights pounding back Red Bull and eating Cheetos on my couch. Overall, it's a nice throwback for all of your favorite Halo game types and maps. I've found that usership has dipped down a bit since Halo 5 picked up and popularity so sometimes you'll wait a bit longer for an online match, but other than that, no complaints. It's a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Zack NicolTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgia.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not much of an online gamer. I bought this game just out of nostalgia. And it delivers sweet nostalgia. I feel like I'm back in high school. I'm amazed at how well Halo CE still holds up as a single player experience. Having the option of switching back an forth between first gen graphics and the remastered graphics is also very neat, though Halo CE looks like crap XD. I'm thoroughly enjoying this trip down memory lane.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase for Halo fans
customer_reviews.text: It had been many years since I played Halo:CE and I wanted to revisit. The game looks great remastered. In addition, Halo 2, 3 & 4 are included in the set. 343 Industries did a great job with this reissue of the first 4 games. In addition there is extra content along with lots of achievements for those who like to increase their gamer score. Highly recommended to all Halo fans and anyone looking for a fantastic game series on 1 disc.
customer_reviews.author: BillofNY2NC

customer_reviews.title: Loving this collection!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not interested in playing any of the multiplayer for Halo so as far as those reviews go, meh. Buy this if you want to play or replay all 4 games!
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo L. Blume

customer_reviews.title: Crashes and bugs!!! DO NOT BUY, or you will be frustrated out of your mind!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not even half way thru the game, and it has crashed/frozen more than 4x. Each time the screen freezes, and you have to go back several episodes to restart. Finally, I got to a point that the game would not let you continue due to a hard crash (nothing would work). It stated on a black screen, "Untracked build, won't upload." This happened at the exact point in the game on Mission 5. I am sick of it, so I am returning. Thank you Amazon.com for having a good return policy on your merchandise.
customer_reviews.author: Captainredfish

customer_reviews.title: Anniversary Halo, and Halo 2.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good collection. The anniversary Halo and Halo 2 are quite nice. Anniversary Halo two might look better than three. It's worth the asking price. That it doesn't incorporate Halo: Reach and ODST from a disk install but must be obtained from the online store is a disappointment but the rest of the collection is entirely solid. Most of the data is downloaded. Not much seems to be actually one the disk which is kinda surprising. I tend to think they should have used more disks in the box and then added things to the install. But whatever it's all there. Unless you don't have the internet. Then it is not.
customer_reviews.author: Tyrell

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Almost Missed the Mark
customer_reviews.text: Games are solid and graphical updates look good. The port is pretty poor tho. Having playing Halo and Halo 2 on the Xbox ad naseum, I can say that there are more visual and gameplay bugs in the MCC than there were in the games released a decade ago. AI seems dumber, dropped weapons sometimes get stuck in walls and some hard crashes. When those sparse issues aren't present 10/10, four player co-op support and classic Halo fps. Worth picking up on sale if you can get past those issues
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: ITS FIXED!!
customer_reviews.text: Halo MCC is fixed!!! My friend has tested the search times for finding multiplayer games and he averaged 60 seconds per search! This game is fixed and there almost little to no lag issues!!! So don't listen to the people are still saying that it's broken and a bad game

customer_reviews.title: Its Halo, remastered with 2 player couch co-op mode!
customer_reviews.text: It's Halo 1-4 remastered! This is a great collection to add to your xbox for the price. The very cool thing about this is you can do 2 player couch co-op in the Halo games. If you have never played halo (like I did), then this will be hours of entertainment. You can actually switch between original Halo graphics and the "remastered" graphics instantly in the game. It's a trip to see how basic the original Halo graphics were.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value

Had a ps3 before for the uncharted series which was awesome in its own way to but this has its special place to.

Add the fact that some of the game features aren't available without Xbox Live is a disappoment. Long live the sticky grenade!!!

customer_reviews.title: Best version of the campaigns

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Games in One
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome! Haven't tried online yet, but the game includes all the missions from the Halo franchises up to Halo 4. customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Game - Just a Microsoft Store Portal, Not a Game
customer_reviews.text: The game plays to a point where you interact with a control device to advance the game. BUT instead of advancing the game you are diverted to Microsoft Store and can not get back to the game. Microsoft Greed has ruined the game. Otherwise is is just an average first person shooter for the little parts of the game you can play. Do Not Buy.
customer_reviews.author: Eagles Wings

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic an UPDATED Halo compilation
customer_reviews.text: This review is made in November 2018. The MCC has been patched almost monthly and now povides a great multiplayer and a PERFECT single player experience for Halo 1, Halo 2, Halo 3, Halo 3 ODST and Halo 4. Playing this in 4k and HDR on a 4K TV is a dream come true. Locked 60fps in all games, it makes you appreciate every campaign even more. I cant stress how good this product is for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Even If You Played Them Before...

The later games get kind of repetitive (here's a room, now kill everything, okay on to the next room) but the multiplayer stays true...local co-op, why'd we stop.

The multiplayer, even though it's supposedly fixed, still leaves me hanging in matchmaking. Not sure if that's because of low player counts, the fact that I'm in Europe, or if it's just a coding problem. But on the rare occasion, I do actually find a match, I have a blast so at least that's something. Not that I play much multiplayer to begin with. I mostly play for the campaign.

customer_reviews.title: Reboot of Classic Game Suffers from XBox1 Pains
customer_reviews.text: New to XBox1, I'm generally not real happy with the overall experience -- but its unclear how much of the issues are Xbox UI vs Halo TMC. I expect most of the issues are XBox related (hangs, repeated need to reboot, unclear error messages, getting stuck in menus, etc.). Actually playing the game is great fun. I'll leave the in-depth Halo reviews to others -- but if you haven't tried it yet, its definitely worth checking out. Likely not going to be your favorite game any more, but still a classic.

customer_reviews.text: This item came just as expected - new and in perfect condition. While the older games are fun to play as a throwback and the story mode is perfect, the online version of the game does not work as it should. This does not have to do with the seller, but it has to do with the actual game and the makers of the game. I would recommend waiting for a new updated version when all of the bugs are fixed out of the game so that you get exactly what you're paying for when you buy a game as awesome as Halo.

product_meta.title: Halo: The Master Chief Collection
product_meta.description:
THE SEEDS OF OUR FUTURE ARE SOWN IN HIS PAST.

For the first time ever, The Master Chief’s entire story is on one console. Featuring a re-mastered Halo 2: Anniversary, along with Halo: Combat Evolved Anniversary, Halo 3, and Halo 4, new digital series, Halo: Nightfall, and access to the Halo 5: Guardians Beta, this is the definitive Halo experience.

 * The Complete Master Chief Story – Honoring the iconic hero and his epic journey, The Master Chief’s entire story is brought together as The Master Chief Collection. Halo: Combat Evolved Anniversary, Halo 2: Anniversary, Halo 3, and Halo 4 are all included with Xbox One visual fidelity, 60fps, a total of 45 campaign missions plus more than 100 multiplayer (including the original Halo Combat Evolved maps) and Spartan Ops maps. Along with new prologue and epilogue cut scenes foreshadowing Halo 5: Guardians, this is the collection Halo fans have been waiting for, all on Xbox One.*
 * Halo 2: Anniversary – Celebrating the 10 year Anniversary, the iconic fan favorite returns. Featuring a fully re-mastered campaign with “Classic Mode” allowing you to instantly switch between the re-mastered game and the original game from 2004. Uncover new Halo 5: Guardians story elements in hidden terminal videos and utilize all new skulls to experience the campaign in a whole new way. Including 23 original multiplayer maps just as fans remember them, plus 6 completely re-imagined maps. Play the game that defined online multiplayer on consoles and get ready for the next Halo chapter. 
 * Master Menu – Seamlessly navigate The Master Chief’s story using the all-new Master Menu. Play all four completely unlocked campaigns, beginning to end, or jump around as you choose. Enjoy cross title themed campaign playlists created by the games’ designers for new fun and challenging experiences. Easily find and play your favorite multiplayer game types from over 100 multiplayer and Spartan Ops maps. It’s everything Halo, on your terms, simplified.
 * New Halo: Nightfall Live Action Digital Series – A strange and treacherous world exposes elite UNSC operatives to a much deeper danger in this live action series from 343 Industries and Scott Free Productions. Executive-produced by Ridley Scott and Scott Free TV President, David Zucker and directed by Sergio Mimica-Gezzan ("Battlestar Galactica" "Pillars of the Earth," "Heroes"), Halo: Nightfall is an exciting new story for Halo fans and fresh audiences alike.
 * Halo 5: Guardians Multiplayer Beta – Be among the first to experience a new generation of Halo multiplayer in the Halo 5: Guardians Beta. Gear up for the Guardians beta by unlocking exclusive content in The Master Chief Collection and Halo: Nightfall. These exclusive items will carry over into Halo 5: Guardians.

*Halo: Nightfall: 5 episode live action series is streaming only, with episodes releasing on a weekly basis. Xbox One or Windows 8.1 and broadband internet required; ISP fees apply. Halo 5: Guardians Beta: Game disc required. Limited Time Beta Starts: December 27, 2014; Ends: January 22, 2015. Must be 17+. Xbox One, broadband internet (ISP fees apply) and Xbox Live Gold membership (sold separately) required. Halo: Nightfall and Halo 5: Guardians Beta dates, content, and features subject to change. See www.xbox.com/halo
